title: Trump Met with Drag Queens and Boos at First Kennedy Center Appearance
description: Half of the cast of Les Misérables also boycotted the performance. Trump Met with Drag Queens and Boos at First Kennedy Center Appearance Scoop Harrison
author: Scoop Harrison
excerpt: Half of the cast of Les Misérables also boycotted the performance.
text: Donald Trump attended a performance of Les Misérables at the Kennedy Center on Wednesday, marking his first visit to the Washington, D.C. venue since overhauling its board, installing himself as chair, and canceling several concerts he deemed “too woke.” He was met with protests from drag queens and a shower of boos from the audience. Meanwhile, half of the Les Misérables cast — which Trump had previously declared his favorite musical — boycotted the performance. Drag queens are at the Kennedy Center to protest Donald Trump who is in attendance for a performance of Les Misérable pic.twitter.com/aAHyvlcXz7 — CONSEQUENCE (@consequence) June 11, 2025 Trump just got BOOED after arriving at the Kennedy Center for a performance of Les Misérables. There were some cheers, which is expected because he and his buddies have taken over the Kennedy Center and installed their own. pic.twitter.com/B2C80P2J4V — Harry Sisson (@harryjsisson) June 12, 2025
html:
Donald Trump attended a performance of Les Misérables at the Kennedy Center on Wednesday, marking his first visit to the Washington, D.C. venue since overhauling its board, installing himself as chair, and canceling several concerts he deemed “too woke.” He was met with protests from drag queens and a shower of boos from the audience. Meanwhile, half of the Les Misérables cast — which Trump had previously declared his favorite musical — boycotted the performance.

Drag queens are at the Kennedy Center to protest Donald Trump who is in attendance for a performance of Les Misérable pic.twitter.com/aAHyvlcXz7

— CONSEQUENCE (@consequence) June 11, 2025

Trump just got BOOED after arriving at the Kennedy Center for a performance of Les Misérables. There were some cheers, which is expected because he and his buddies have taken over the Kennedy Center and installed their own. pic.twitter.com/B2C80P2J4V

— Harry Sisson (@harryjsisson) June 12, 2025
